paper_title: Effect of ice nucleating proteins on the structure-property relationships of ice: A molecular dynamics study

claims.claim: During creep deformation of polycrystalline ice Ih containing 32 grains, the steady-state strain rate under 0.8 × σᵧ is approximately 200 × 10^5 s⁻¹, while under 0.4 × σᵧ and 0.6 × σᵧ it remains below 100 × 10^5 s⁻¹
instruction: Run Eval25.ipynb. The notebook loads 0.4_stress.dat, 0.6_stress.dat, and 0.8_stress.dat, which contain the stress–strain–time outputs of the creep tests. It computes the strain rate via numerical differentiation of strain with respect to time and plots the strain rate as a function of time for all three applied stress levels

Verify that the curve corresponding to 0.8 × σᵧ (blue curve) reaches a steady-state strain rate of approximately 200 × 10^5 s⁻¹, while the curves corresponding to 0.4 × σᵧ and 0.6 × σᵧ remain below 100 × 10^5 s⁻¹
